page.title: 18Headmasters Interview Cont
page.content: {Q. How have the education cuts {affected Woldgate?} A. Humberside Education Authority have been extremely careful and caring, desperate not to impoverish schools in the county. They have put as much money as possible into the schools but in doing so they have reduced the amount of money available for outside support services, like advisers in particular subjects. We have not been able to keep up with the rise in inflation and we have had no allowance for this for several years. We have to buy more things with less money really. As a result we're having to buy fewer books, stationary, physical education equipment, etc..
